The film follows Ten- year- old Arthur, in a bid to save his grandfather' s house from being demolished, goes looking for some much- fabled hidden treasure in the land of the Minimoys, tiny people living in harmony with nature.

Based on your preferences for genre and actors, I would highly recommend watching "Gangs of New York." This classic film stars Tim Pigott-Smith as Amsterdam Vallon, Cara Seymour as Bill the Butcher, and Dabney Coleman as the French Count.
The plot follows the life of Amsterdam Vallon, a gangster from New York City. Vallon returns to the Five Points area of New York City seeking revenge against Bill the Butcher, his father' s killer.
Meanwhile, in England, a French count is in love with the princess. Unfortunately, tragedy strikes when the princess is killed by an iguana pets called Nanas.
Feeling heartbroken and lost without her, the French count turns to an expert for help in time travel back before the murder.
But things don't go as planned. The French count ends up in Chicago, April 2000. He meets a descendant who helps him return to the 1100s.
Overall, "Gangs of New York" is an excellent film that offers a captivating storyline, well-developed characters, and great cinematography. I highly recommend watching this classic film.
